page.title: 05Hornby Village-Layout
page.content: Hornby lies on a North-South axis. The main road through the village is the A683. It is called Main Street within the village boundaries.The houses on Main Street were built between the 17th. and 19th. Centuries, many are stone built terraced houses. Since the end of the Second World War, modern detatched and semi-detatched houses have been built. The first development was that of Hornby Bank and Royal Oak Meadow at the North end of the village. Secondly, Monteagle Drive and Stanley Drive were built to the East of Main Street. In the late 1960's Post Horse Lane and Hornby Hall Close (both cul-de-sacs) were built to the West of Main Street. The latest development, currently nearing completion, is that of Lunesdale Court 1 km. SW of Hornby. The old Rural District Council Offices are being converted into family homes.
